[MENU](https://wallstreetpit.com/128295-spacex-said-to-weigh-tie%E2%80%91up-with-tesla-or-xai/#)

- SpaceX is actively exploring potential mergers with either Tesla (TSLA) or xAI as part of Elon Musk’s strategy to integrate his companies, leveraging synergies such as orbital AI data centers, Tesla’s energy storage expertise, and possible future transport of Optimus robots to the Moon or Mars.
- Discussions remain preliminary with no final decisions made, though any transaction could attract major interest from infrastructure funds and Middle Eastern sovereign investors and would likely require significant financing.
- Tesla shares rose as much as 3% to $428.49 in after-hours trading following the news, while SpaceX continues preparations for a potential blockbuster IPO targeting a $1.5 trillion valuation and up to $50 billion in proceeds.

![spaceX, xAI](https://wallstreetpit.com/wp-content/uploads/news/ai-cg/xAI-G.jpg)

Elon Musk’s SpaceX is exploring strategic combinations that could reshape his sprawling business empire, with discussions underway about potential mergers involving Tesla Inc. (TSLA) or artificial intelligence startup xAI, [according](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/elon-musk-spacex-said-consider-222218321.html) to Bloomberg sources familiar with the matter. These deliberations highlight Musk’s efforts to integrate his ventures, leveraging synergies in space technology, AI computing, and energy systems amid preparations for a massive initial public offering.

The merger considerations stem from Musk’s overarching ambitions for SpaceX, which include deploying orbital data centers capable of handling intensive AI computations. A tie-up with xAI could provide that company with access to such space-based processing power, assuming the technical challenges are overcome, enhancing xAI’s capabilities in advanced machine learning models like those powering conversational AI systems.
